ENGLISH

The Fortress (La Commanderie, 2010)
France

Presentation:

The Fortress was a hit on French television and it is finally coming to take US viewers on the same riveting journey. In the same tone as Sean ConneryÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s The Name of the Rose, the series shows the middle ages as a dark and turbulent period when religion ran society and led to tragic results.

During the middle ages, an order of religious faithful controlled a fortress in Burgundy. This is the setting of the French TV series The Fortress. This eight episode TV series shows a thrilling story, shot on location at Saone, Loire, Guedelon and in the Yonne regions.

The daily routine, hectic as it is, is thrown into further disarray one day, when a high ranking Hospitaller comes to inspect the facilities. Though not an immediate danger, many within the walls feel highly uncomfortable with the situation. What follows this seemingly ordinary inspection is thrillingly played out by a wonderful cast of actors.  

The Fortress stars Clement Sibony as Captain Thomas Cortmain. The Noble Lady Constanza, who dwells in the castle near the fortress is played by Louise Pasteau. The medic Elias Sabet is portrayed by Mahen Kamoun, and the leading authority of the fortress, Roger de Neuville, is brilliantly brought to life by the acting of Carlo Brandt.
